original:
In 1824, François Magendie made significant contributions to the field of physiology by describing the sensory roots of the nervous system and providing the first evidence of the cerebellum's role in maintaining equilibrium. His work complemented the earlier Bell–Magendie law, which delineates the functions of sensory and motor nerves.

During the 1820s, French physiologist Henri Milne-Edwards introduced the concept of physiological div

In 1824, François Magendie made significant contributions to the field of physiology by describing the sensory roots of the nervous entity and providing the first evidence of the cerebellum's role in maintaining equilibrium. His work complemented the earlier Bell–Magendie law, which delineates the functions of sensory and action nerves.
